good.name: Good
good.philosophy: Uphold justice, protect the weak, fight against evil
good.description: Good characters are driven by a desire to help others and fight against injustice. They believe in protecting the innocent and upholding moral principles, even at personal cost.

benefits.name: Holy Weapon Access
benefits.description: Can use blessed and holy weapons that deal extra damage to evil creatures

benefits.name: Enhanced Healing
benefits.description: +10% effectiveness on all healing spells and abilities

benefits.name: Turn Undead
benefits.description: Ability to turn or destroy undead creatures through divine power

benefits.name: Damage vs Evil
benefits.description: +1 damage bonus when fighting evil-aligned creatures

benefits.name: Divine Protection
benefits.description: Resistance to fear effects and evil-based attacks

restrictions.name: No Evil Items
restrictions.description: Cannot equip cursed, evil, or necromantic items

restrictions.name: Protect Innocents
restrictions.description: Cannot harm innocent NPCs or allow them to be harmed without consequence

restrictions.name: Honor Code
restrictions.description: Must keep promises and cannot use underhanded tactics

neutral.name: Neutral
neutral.philosophy: Pragmatic approach, balance in all things
neutral.description: Neutral characters seek balance and take a pragmatic approach to problems. They are not bound by rigid moral codes but act according to circumstance and personal benefit.

benefits.name: Equipment Versatility
benefits.description: Can use most magical items without alignment restrictions

benefits.name: Skill Progression
benefits.description: +5% bonus to all skill advancement rates

benefits.name: Diplomatic Immunity
benefits.description: Neutral stance in conflicts, accepted by most factions

benefits.name: Balanced Magic
benefits.description: Access to both beneficial and harmful spells without restriction

benefits.name: Adaptability
benefits.description: Versatility bonus when using different equipment types

restrictions.name: Limited Extremes
restrictions.description: Some restrictions on the most powerful good or evil items

restrictions.name: No Zealotry
restrictions.description: Cannot take extreme moral stances that would shift alignment

evil.name: Evil
evil.philosophy: Achieve goals by any means, power through strength
evil.description: Evil characters are driven by personal ambition and the pursuit of power. They are willing to use any means necessary to achieve their goals, including harming others for personal gain.

benefits.name: Dark Weapon Access
benefits.description: Can wield cursed and necromantic weapons with enhanced power

benefits.name: Necromantic Magic
benefits.description: Access to dark magic schools including necromancy and curses

benefits.name: Intimidation Mastery
benefits.description: +2 bonus to intimidation and fear-based abilities

benefits.name: Damage vs Good
benefits.description: +1 damage bonus when fighting good-aligned creatures

benefits.name: Dark Resilience
benefits.description: Resistance to good-based attacks and turning attempts

restrictions.name: No Holy Items
restrictions.description: Cannot equip blessed, holy, or divine items

restrictions.name: Selfish Nature
restrictions.description: Cannot cast beneficial spells on good-aligned characters

restrictions.name: Reputation Cost
restrictions.description: Actions are viewed with suspicion by good and neutral NPCs

same_alignment.description: Characters of the same alignment generally trust and support each other

opposed_alignment.description: Good and Evil alignments are fundamentally opposed and distrust each other

neutral_interactions.description: Neutral alignment serves as a bridge between good and evil

alignment_drift.description: Character actions can gradually shift alignment over time

help_innocent.description: Helping innocent people pushes toward good alignment

kill_innocent.description: Harming innocents pushes strongly toward evil

donate_charity.description: Charitable acts support good and neutral alignments

steal_from_poor.description: Stealing from the needy is considered evil

negotiate_peace.description: Peaceful solutions support neutral and good alignments

murder_for_gain.description: Killing for personal benefit is a strong evil act

protect_weak.description: Protecting the defenseless is considered good

alignment_drift.description_threshold: Characters need 20+ drift points to change alignment

holy_items.evil_restriction: This holy item burns your evil hands!

cursed_items.good_restriction: You cannot bring yourself to wield this cursed weapon!

neutral_items.description: Most standard equipment can be used by any alignment

reputation_effects.description: Reputation affects prices, quest availability, and NPC interactions
